snippet: The drug agency said Monday that products from a Massachusetts company linked to a meningitis outbreak may have also caused other types of infections.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration officials warn more people may be at risk from contaminated drugs made by New England Compounding Center, Massachusetts company linked to growing meningitis outbreak that has killed 15 patients and infected almost 200 others in 15 states; report the company's products may have also caused other types of infections in patients who have had eye operations or open-heart surgery.

byline.original: By DENISE GRADY and SABRINA TAVERNISE

lead_paragraph: The drug agency said Monday that products from a Massachusetts company linked to a meningitis outbreak may have also caused other types of infections.

headline.seo: Wider Meningitis Risk From Tainted Drugs Feared
headline.main: F.D.A. Warns of Further Risk From Tainted Drugs
headline.print_headline: New Infections May Be Linked To Drug Maker
